sub_title: Freelance SEO Consultant Netherlands | Specialized in Organic Growth | SEO | Social media |
summary:
You are now at the LinkedIn profile of Jenny Schouten, Freelancer SEO consultant Netherlands of SchoutenSEO. 
I’m specialized in: 
- Preparing an SEO strategies
- Improving Technical SEO 
- Delivery Content SEO tactics 
- OnPage SEO / OnPage optimization
- Authority SEO / Off Page SEO / Link building
- Result driven approach with agreed KPI (for example: growth year over year / organic traffic / non-bounced generic organic traffic)

SchoutenSEO provides the following SEO services: 
- SEO audit / SEO maintenance 
- Custom-made SEO advice
- SEO content coaching
- SEO competitors  analysis
- Load Page Speed analysis and improvements
- Local SEO visibility improvements
- Management of Social Media Channels (My Business/Facebook/Instagram etc.)

When I am giving advice I am use to work with:
- CEOs, founders, board members
- In-house teams
- Head of marketing and/or the marketing department
- Front-end developers
- Back-end developers
- Junior content writers
- Senior content writers
- Final editors 
- Bloggers

profile_positions.description:
After a few years working in different positions in the Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) and Organic Growth Business. I wanted to share my experience and expertise  with businesses around me. So in June 2019 I decided to start my own business called SchoutenSEO. 

SchoutenSEO is a company based in Limburg, south of Netherlands that is specialized in SEO. SchoutenSEO gives daily SEO advice to local, national and international companies. Do you want to know how your business is scoring in SEO or would you like a SEO audit of your website or online store? Please send an email to jenny@schoutenseo.com or give me a call on 0031- 06 20 34 63 07.
profile_positions.title: Freelance SEO Consultant Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
Justix GmbH is an international company builder for LegalTech businesses.

HelloLaw, is there main project, currently assists with legal advice to more than 13.000 customers in the Netherlands. Redefining the way that legal services are provided is its fundamental goal and in order to do so, we are developing several solutions based on document automation, chatbots, AI, and every new technology that can substantially improve legal services. Next to HelloLaw, the Netherlands, we are also working on HelloLaw, Germany. 

As a Head of SEO I’m responsible for everything that has to do with SEO.
profile_positions.title: Head of SEO

profile_positions.description:
WaarBenJij.nu is the largest online travel community of the Netherlands with over 1 million unique visitors per month and 11 million page views.

In 2012 I worked for eight months at WaarBenJij.nu. First as full time intern - brand identity and brand image researcher and later on as a full time customer service representative. At the moment I work part time from home as a customer service representative.

I provide this customer service online, by email and through the Facebook Fanpage. The service is mostly in Dutch, but in some cases it's in English or another language.
profile_positions.title: Customer service representative

profile_positions.description:
Dutch Rana is a company that is specialized in breeding and keeping dendrobaten (mostly from South America.) Besides the poisonous frogs, they also offer custom made terrariums, rack systems, tropical plants and materials that you may need in this industry. The company is stationed in Heerlen, The Netherlands (close to the German and Belgian border.)

Mid-April 2012 I launched the Facebook fanpage of Dutch Rana: www.facebook.com/dutchrana. It’s a small community where I inform visitors from all over the world, using English. This information concerns new imports, new products, information about exhibitions and much more. Besides managing the Facebook fan page, I’m also improving all of the communication tools of Dutch Rana and expending the open door day.

In July 2013 I started to work as a financial adminstrator. My main tasks were accountancy, creating invoices and other financial tasks. Besides the financial tasks I have also done general adminstration such as entering data for sending packets with DHL and inventory.

The languages I speak are mostly Dutch and English (Oral and written) but in some cases another language.
profile_positions.title: Financial administrator and community manager

profile_positions.description:
Camping en Tentenhotel Les Ormes is a campsite that is located in between the beautiful hills of Lot-et-Garonne. In the summer of 2014 I have worked at the reception, in addition I also supported my colleagues with other tasks when needed.

My main tasks at the reception were:
-	Accounting / finance tasks
-	Managing e-mails
-	Managing the planning of all the desert tents (decorated tents) and pitches, by accepting reservations, adding and/or adjusting reservations
-	Managing the contact with the particular partners of the campsite
-	Making the check-in and check-outs

The languages I used during this period were mostly English and Dutch (Oral and written) but in some cases I also had to use my basic German as well as my French language skills.

The skills I have acquired during this work are: communication (oral/written and verbal/non verbal), time management, stress resistance, planning, Microsoft Excell, multitasking, flexibility, financial indept of the company, "French" accounting skills and general financial skills.
profile_positions.title: Receptionist and financial administrator

profile_positions.description:
Huis voor de Sport Limburg is a provincial sports organization, that is active in the province Limburg (in the south of the Netherlands). Huis voor de Sport Limburg advises and assists municipality (communities) and sports organizations on issues in the field of sport and exercise. With the ultimate goal; that every Limburger will participate in sport/exercise, because movement is progress!

I worked as a full time projectmanager for eight months. My main projects were:
-	Sportdatabank Limburg. A website where you can find all sport organizations and accommodations in the province Limburg. My main tasks were to create a user friendly webpage (in cooperation with website developers) and contacting all sports organizations and sports accommodations to collect the data. On legal level I had to find out all the theory related to the privacy of the sport organizations, develop a methodology to keep the sports database annually in the most effective way as possible and develop a marketing and communication plan.
-	Developing a Twitter policy and a customized Twitter guideline for the employees of the organization.
-	Desk research about developing new products and/or services and the feasibility within a certain budget.
-	Support activities for the knowledge and marketing/communication team.

The skills I have acquired are communication (oral and written), branding, planning, analyzing, quality and vision orientation. Besides these competencies I have also acquired a lot of knowledge about the programs; Google Maps and Microsoft Excel.
profile_positions.title: Projectmanager

profile_positions.description:
WaarBenJij.nu is the largest online travel community of the Netherlands with over 1 million unique visitors per month and 11 million page views.

After my Bachelor Thesis, I have worked as customer service representative at WaarBenJij.nu. I assisted WaarBenJij.nu with the launch of the new and innovative WaarBenJij.nu (July 2012), because of the launch a lot of people had questions about the website (from functions on the website to ordering a picture album or VIP packet).

During these two months I learned a lot about the website, especially how to explain to visitors how they could do certain actions and how to satisfy visitors/customers when there was a problem or when something went wrong.

I provided this service online (by email and Facebook), but also by telephone. The service was mostly in Dutch, but in some cases in English or another language.
profile_positions.title: Customer service representative

profile_positions.description:
WaarBenJij.nu is the largest online travel community of the Netherlands with over 1 million unique visitors per month and 11 million page views.

My bachelor thesis (written in Dutch) was about the brand identity and brand image of WaarBenJij.nu. To produce my bachelor thesis; an intern research (qualitative) had to take place, because this is the only way to get insight of the identity of a brand. After doing this research the basis for the market research (quantitative) was created. The main focus of the market research was the brand image of WaarBenJij.nu, in four different categories: brand awareness, brand association, brand knowledge and brand loyalty. 

Important details: 
- The target group of the market research was the Dutch internet population. 
- The collected data was analyzed with the statistics program SPSS, version 17.0 and all the 
 results have a confidence interval of 95% over the whole Dutch internet population.

The skills I acquired during the time I was writing my Bachelor thesis are planning, analyzing, giving judgment, quality and vision orientation. Besides these competencies I also acquired a lot of knowledge of the statistics program SPSS, version 17.0.
profile_positions.title: Brand identity and brand image researcher

company.name: NHTV Breda University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.company: NHTV Breda University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description:
NHTV Insight is the digital newsletter of NHTV Breda University of Applied Sciences that is sent to all NHTV e-mail accounts of students and employees. Students receive the Insight Students and NHTV employees receive the Insight Employees.

It’s a newsletter with important and useful information for students and employees written by students and the communication office of NHTV. There are articles about the activities that are going on, trends & developments, important things to know as a student, part time jobs, stories of students that went abroad and much more.

My main task was collecting import information by visiting events, conduct interviews and take pictures. After collecting the data I wrote articles (in both Dutch and English). Besides that I also promoted the NHTV Insight and found out how we could improve the digital newsletter.

The skills I acquired during this work are: networking, communication (oral and written), situational awareness and vision.
profile_positions.title: Employee Internal Communications
